title: Dream A Dream
detailsOfAchievement: Dream A Dream was recognised by the National HRD Network in 2007 as a leading NGO impacting change. The Credibility Alliance too recognises us as a leading non-profit organisation that is transparent, accountable and meets national reporting standards. Charities Aid Foundation, India, validates our work; we are a part of their network of beneficiary organisations. 1. Among the eight regional finalists at the Apeejay India Volunteer Awards in 2011. 2. Regional Winner (South) in the Medium Category at the India NGO Awards 2009 and Regional Winner (South) in the Small Category in 2007. The India NGO Awards are organised by the Resource Alliance and supported by The Rockefeller Foundation. The award recognises our adoption of best practices in creative resourcing, financial management, governance and impact in the community. 3. Winner at the Outstanding Annual Reports Awards, 2011 (medium category); runners up in 2009 and 2010 in the small category. 4. Global Runner-Up at the Japanese Award for the Most Innovative Development Project hosted by the Global Development Network. It recognises our innovative approach to empower young people from Bangalores slum communities through life skills based education programmes, ability to engage volunteers, and our low-cost, replicable, scalable model to partner with NGO run schools and shelter homes. Most importantly, the award recognises our strategic planning processes that help quickly adapt to the dynamically changing environment and respond to the needs of the target community effectively. 5. Co-founder and Executive Director, Vishal Talreja, is an Ashoka Fellow (www.ashoka.org).

detailsOfAchievement: GREEN Foundation works towards a well-preserved, diverse ecosystem that will sustain the rural livelihoods of the present generation without eroding the resource base of future. Its Mission is to conserve local seed diversity, promote an increased reliance on biodiversity based ecological agriculture; create gender-sensitive environment that enhances women leadership; contribute to livelihood by creating marketing value added products; connect the natural elements (soil, water, air, sunlight and seed) to ensure an abundance of nutritious food and otehr basic community seed; continue to nuture community participation and assist in building robust community organisation. GREEN Foundation works with over 2,400 women farmers in Kanakapura Taluk. Jandhanya Producer Federation and Companies, over 130 Self Help Groups, and 15 Enterprise Groups are formed. The producer institutions produce and market over 40 products in local and Bangalore markets. GREEN Foundation has published a number of articles and books related to biodiversity and ecological agriculture. Five key program areas that GREEN Foundation Works: 1. Conservation of agro-bio diversity through community seed banks, local seed savers, kitchen gardens 2. Promotion of sustainable agriculture and farming 3. Certifications for sustainable agriculture 4. Research and Communication - evolutionary plant breeding, molecular finger printing of local varieties 5. Policy engagement and networking GREEN Foundation plans to expand its operations within and beyond Karnataka in coming years. The Foundation has worked with a number of partners who have supported in various ways.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: International Participation in Earth Science Olympiad. The International Earth Science Olympiad (IESO) is organised annually for higher secondary school students hailing from different countries across the world. It is one of the important programmes of the International Geoscience Education Organisation(IGEO; www.geoscied.org) promoting earth science education in schools all over the world. The principal objectives of IESO are to upraise student interest in and public awareness of Earth Science

International Participation in Earth Science Olympiad Unlike the other International Olympiads conducted on subjects such as astronomy, life sciences, chemistry, physics and mathematics, the Geological Society of India, Bangalore, as a part of its outreach programme towards popularising Earth Sciences to school students, conducts the Indian National Earth Science Olympiad and participates in the IESO programme every year. As in the previous years, the entrance test was conducted in 64 centres.

International Participation in Earth Science Olympiad IESO is an annual earth science competition for secondary school students, one of the main activities of International Geoscience Educational Organization (IGEO), affiliated to the International Union of Geological Sciences (IUGS). The IESOs mission is to raise awareness and interest in Earth Sciences among school children as well as general public to improve Earth Science learning of students.

detailsOfAchievement: IEEE has been working world wide to advance technology for humanity for over 130 years. India provides huge opportunities for IEEE since the country is in the phase of rapid growth and has well integrated into global innovation value chain. Indias vast education system produces millions of graduates in Science and Engineering disciplines. Indian companies work round the clock to develop IT solutions. Indian government is rapidly adopting technology to improve the quality of life for its people. IEEE in India has been active since 1976 and has 11 sections and 5 subsections and several hundred student chapters. India also has a country council. IEEE India office as subsidiary started in Sep 2010. However, started functioning since June 2011. India office is focusing on Standards and Education, besides that provides support for digital library, Computer Society, MGA and software development. India office looks into business opportunities for various functions of IEEE in India. GIEEE India office also plays a key-roll in compliance with local laws of conducting IEEE activities in India.

detailsOfAchievement: We are witnessing hundreds of instances of various types of exploitation of women in the patriarchal society of India, where women are compared respectfully to Goddesses and worshipped. Women are forced to struggle at every step to retain her professional freedom, self-respect and equality with males socially and domestically. In such circumstances this organisation is like an oasis for the downtrodden women (womens health education and cultural development organisation). This organisation, which was started in 2003-2004 has initiated action in the direction of rescuing and developing the cultural bedrock of law and order of our country. It has formed programmes to deliver the benefit of the Government schemes for backward and downtrodden lot of all communities. It is really a tragedy that a section of the society has to supress their pains and pleasures and struggle for a morsel of food and a piece of cloth. When the founder Secretary and the office bearers of this society started searching for the cause for this, they discovered that it would definitely be possible to bring about a change in their life, if the fundamental facilities like education, employment and privileges provided by the Government. S.J.S.RY.M.C.C. Mysore is the first organisation, in collaborating with J.S.S ShramikVidyapeetha, which provided training to women who were below the poverty line in beautician course, candle making, soap oil, Phenol, preparing different food products in collaboration with CFTRI - which later became MysoreMahilaSamsthe. With the cange of name the area of activity also expanded. Going a step ahead the activities encompassed Adult Education, Tailoring training, Embroidery, Zari work, Mehendi training which inspired way for the self sufficiency of women. Change is not stagnant water. It is like a coursing river. In 2006  2007, as per the decision of the executive committee, and after realising that only through imparting knowledge it will be possible to bring changes in the lower strata of the society it was decided to rename the organisation as GnanaJyothiSamsthe. Through this organisation it has been creating awareness to women and men in the 65 wards laying stress on Legal education, health, domestic system, nursing and nourishing children, solid waste management, comfort centre and economic reforms of women. In recognition of this Nehru Yuva Kendra organisation has honoured this organisation by giving award. Later in 2008-2009 the Kitturu Rani Chennamma award of Karnataka Government, which is given to those who have served in the field of womens upliftment, was given to our founder Secretary SmtHemavathi in recognition of her service. The award was conferred by the Chief Minister Sri.Yediyurappa and Sri Narendraswamy who was the Minister of Women and children development along with the cabinet members in the banquet hall of Vidhanasoudha. After this increased responsibility, the president of our organisation and other office bearers delegated the responsibility of getting the benefits given by the Government offices and expanding the field of work to the Secretary. Many politicians who watched the popularity among the masses, especially women, from close quarters tried to involve her in politics. But she chose social service over politics. Instead she formed many programmes like information about Government scheme to people, counselling, leadership awareness counselling, distribution of tailoring machine to widows, free legal aid to victims of atrocities against women, women related workshops, family counselling etc., and made GnanaJyothiSamsthe synonymous with comfort for the downtrodden women of all the 65 wards, belonging to all communities. It has given solace, avareness, aid, protest and achievement of goal which is recognised by the Suddikaigannadi newspaper which conferred MysoreRatna and MysoreNakshatra awards. This and the award given by Women and children welfare social welfare departments of Mysore Corporation has helped our organisation create its footprints in the city and towns. ShrimatiHemavathi was chosen as the president of Mysore District Strishakti organisation. This helped her to increase her field of opertions resulting in more stress to monetary empowerment of women, free tuition classes to failed students of SSLC with the collaboration of MysoreCity Corporation, beautician, fashion designing, Spoken English, finding market for the articles produced by women. Recognising the planning and efficiency of our secretary, she was appointed as member of the complaint redressal committee which was formed as per the order of the Supreme Court of India, by the Deputy Commissioner Sri Manivannan. The additional Magistrate Sri Betsurmat provided NanjarajaBahaddurChoultry for 7 days free of cost for creating market for the articles created by the members of the organisation. This helped to inspire women in finding market for their produce. Sri Sureshkumar Law Minister who participated in this program praised that this organisation was a role model for all organisations in the state. As a result of this many eatables were supplied to the canteens of BEML and L&T, and market was provided for the Jariwork and Jariworksarees. Loan schemes from different banks were provided. In this way GnanaJyothiSamsthe has given solace to the backward poor communities, men and women in the districts of Karnataka. This endeavour of providing solace, inspiration is inspired by many officials of the corporation, Corporation commissioner Raikar, Additional District Magistrate Sri Naganayak, several intellectuals, elders, notables and politicians. We request the continuance of their cooperation and assistance for expanding our operation of providing from the affluent to the needy in future. Likewise our organization forwards, in 2010 district welfare center coordinately Mysore allotted places to conduct spoken englingh to these place located students, and conducted about waste management awareness program in bannur town municipal council area on 2012.in the year 2013-14 got an work order about various skill development trainings from VTP Karnataka government implemented and successfully completed. And also conducted thikshna coordinately awareness about mutual funds and banking in Mysore urban areas. In the year 2015 Mysore city corporation coordinately conducted health awareness, sanitation awareness and legal awareness in Mysore sixty five wards. And AIMS coordinately our organization conducted NSDC training related programs. In the year 2016 KVTSDC government of Karnataka various skill development programs conducted by our organization. At the end of year 2016 our organization survey conducted about child labour find out district labour department coordinately. Likewise our organization various department co operatively conducted various social works and providing service to the people honorably. In this way our organization gowned and we gave complete details about our organization.
